title: PTC Therapeutics Vatiquinone Program Update for Friedreich's Ataxia – January 21, 2025
description:
FARA's Mission is to marshal and focus the resources and relationships needed to cure Friedreich's Ataxia (FA) by raising funds for research, promoting public awareness, and aligning scientists, patients, clinicians, government agencies, pharmaceutical companies and other organizations dedicated to curing FA and related diseases.

Friedreich’s Ataxia is a debilitating, life-shortening, degenerative neuro-muscular disorder. About one in 50,000 people in the United States have Friedreich's Ataxia.

This video is a recording of an informational webinar hosted by PTC Therapeutics on January 21, 2025. Chief Executive Officer of PTC Therapeutics, Matt Klein, M.D., M.S., F.A.C.S., joined FARA to discuss the vatiquinone program. Vatiquinone (PTC-743) is an investigational drug that aims to improve mitochondrial and cellular function by targeting 15-lipoxygenase. It is under evaluation and not approved by the FDA as of the date of this recording.  Information shared in this webinar is for educational purposes only and should not be construed as medical advice. FARA makes no representations regarding the information included in the recording. Those viewing the recording after January 21, 2025, are reminded that the field is constantly evolving, and the information contained in this recording may have changed. Anyone considering participating in a clinical trial should discuss the matter with their physician. FARA does not endorse or recommend any particular study.

title: 224  Friedreich ataxia
description:
Take-Home Point:
💡 Friedreich ataxia is an autosomal recessive trinucleotide repeat disorder (GAA) on chromosome 9, leading to mitochondrial dysfunction and degeneration of spinocerebellar tracts, dorsal columns, and corticospinal tracts. It presents with progressive ataxia, loss of proprioception, absent DTRs, pes cavus, and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.

title: Post 53 | Overcoming Communication Barriers with Large Language Models
description:
Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing communication for individuals with conditions like Friedreich's Ataxia. The key lies in their training on extensive linguistic datasets. These datasets provide the LLM with a rich understanding of syntax, morphology, and semantics. The benefits extend beyond simple translation. LLMs reduce the cognitive load associated with communication, allowing individuals to focus on the content of their message rather than the mechanics of speech. 
They also offer increased accessibility, providing a consistent and reliable communication tool that can be used in a variety of settings. Furthermore, these models can be integrated with various devices, offering flexible and adaptable solutions. We explore how the sophisticated linguistic processing within these models is enabling more effective and cohesive communication for Andrew Marshall and others, and how these benefits are transforming lives.
Key Benefits to Emphasize:
Increased Independence: LLMs empower individuals to communicate without constant reliance on others.
Reduced Frustration: Clearer communication minimizes misunderstandings and frustration.
Enhanced Social Inclusion: Improved communication facilitates meaningful social interactions.
Faster Communication: LLMs can process and generate responses quickly, improving communication efficiency.
Accuracy: LLMs can accurately interpret fragmented or altered speech.
Personalization: Models can be tailored to individual speech patterns.
Reduced Cognitive Load: LLMs handle the linguistic processing, allowing users to focus on their message.
Increased Accessibility: LLMs provide a reliable communication tool in various settings.
Adaptability: LLMs can be integrated with various devices and platforms.
Improved Quality of Life: Overall, LLMs contribute to a better quality of life by facilitating effective communication.

title: Friedreich's Ataxia (FA) What is this rare disease? A new chapter for us!
description:
Friedreich's ataxia (FA) is a rare, inherited disease that causes progressive damage to the nervous system: 

Symptoms usually begin between the ages of 5 and 15, but can appear later in life: 
Impaired muscle coordination (ataxia) 
Difficulty walking 
Poor balance 
Loss of sensation in the arms and legs 
Slowed speech 
Hearing loss 
Vision loss 
Scoliosis (curvature of the spine) 
Heart disease, such as hypertrophic cardiomyopathy 
Diabetes.

Prognosis.. Most patients die within ten to 20 years after being diagnosed. Some die much sooner, as each individuals body progresses at different levels. There is NO known cure and the life of a person with this disease will be incredibly challenging!

title: Ask the Ataxia Expert with Dr. Susan Perlman | January 2025
description:
Dr. Susan Perlman of UCLA Medical Center in Los Angeles joined us on January 8th, 2025, to answer the community's questions about Ataxia. The National Ataxia Foundation is proud to present this next installment in our Ask the Expert series.

To learn from other sessions with Dr. Perlman, visit www.ataxia.org/AsktheExpert

Ataxia is a rare neurological disease that can have a wide array of genetic origins. For more information on Ataxia, please visit our website: www.ataxia.org 

Become a Free NAF member! http://bit.ly/JoinNAF

Follow us on Social Media!
NAF Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/ataxiafounda... 
NAF Twitter:  https://twitter.com/NAF_Ataxia 
NAF Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ataxiafound... 
NAF Subreddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/ataxia/ 

About the Ataxia Expert:

Susan Perlman, MD is a graduate of Cornell University and the State University of New York at Stony Brook School of Medicine. She did an internship in medicine, her residency in neurology, and a two-year fellowship in Friedreich's Ataxia at UCLA Medical Center. Dr. Perlman is currently a Clinical Professor of Neurology and Director of the Ataxia Center at the UCLA Medical Center in Los Angeles, CA. She has been head of the Ataxia Center at UCLA since 1983. She has worked in Ataxia diagnosis for over 30 years and has networked with other “Ataxologists” across the country and around the world, trying to build better collaboration in the development to treatments and ultimately cures. She helped develop the National Ataxia Database for clinical research. She is participating in 2 natural history studies (for dominant Ataxia and Friedreich’s Ataxia) and has participated in 7 clinical drug trials. Dr. Perlman would like to expand the work being done in non-genetic Ataxia as well. Dr. Perlman authored Evaluation and Management of Ataxic Disorders: An Overview for Physicians which has become a valuable resource for NAF.

title: CANVAS
description:
Canvas Syndrome Lecture

Introduction:
Canvas Syndrome, also known as Cerebellar Ataxia with Neuropathy and Vestibular Areflexia Syndrome (CANVAS), is a rare, progressive neurological disorder characterized by a triad of symptoms affecting balance, coordination, and sensory perception. This lecture will cover its clinical features, pathophysiology, diagnosis, and management.

1. Clinical Features:
 • Cerebellar Ataxia:
 • Involves impaired coordination of voluntary movements.
 • Symptoms include gait ataxia, difficulty with fine motor tasks, and tremors.
 • Neuropathy:
 • Peripheral sensory neuropathy, primarily affecting the sensory nerves.
 • Symptoms include numbness, tingling, and loss of sensation in the extremities.
 • Vestibular Areflexia:
 • Loss of vestibular function, leading to balance issues and dizziness.
 • Patients often report unsteadiness, especially in low-light conditions.

2. Pathophysiology:
 • CANVAS is considered a neurodegenerative disorder affecting the cerebellum, peripheral nerves, and vestibular system.
 • The exact cause is unknown, but genetic factors may play a role.
 • Recent studies suggest a potential link to mutations in the RFC1 (Replication Factor C Subunit 1) gene.

3. Diagnosis:
 • Clinical Evaluation:
 • Comprehensive neurological examination to assess ataxia, sensory loss, and vestibular function.
 • Electrophysiological Studies:
 • Nerve conduction studies (NCS) and electromyography (EMG) to evaluate peripheral neuropathy.
 • Vestibular Testing:
 • Video Head Impulse Test (vHIT) and caloric testing to assess vestibular function.
 • Imaging:
 • MRI of the brain to rule out other causes of ataxia and to assess cerebellar atrophy.
 • Genetic Testing:
 • Testing for RFC1 gene mutations if clinically indicated.

4. Differential Diagnosis:
 • Multiple System Atrophy (MSA)
 • Friedreich’s Ataxia
 • Spinocerebellar Ataxia (SCA)
 • Chronic Inflammatory Demyelinating Polyneuropathy (CIDP)

5. Management:
 • Symptomatic Treatment:
 • Physical therapy and rehabilitation to improve balance and coordination.
 • Vestibular rehabilitation exercises to help with dizziness and balance.
 • Supportive Care:
 • Occupational therapy for daily living adaptations.
 • Orthopedic interventions for neuropathic complications (e.g., foot drop).
 • Medications:
 • No disease-modifying treatments currently available.
 • Medications may be used to manage symptoms like neuropathic pain or tremors.

6. Prognosis:
 • CANVAS is a progressive condition, leading to gradual worsening of symptoms.
 • Life expectancy is typically not significantly reduced, but quality of life may be impacted.
 • Early diagnosis and management can help improve functional outcomes and reduce complications.

Conclusion:
Canvas Syndrome is a complex, multi-system disorder requiring a multidisciplinary approach for effective management. Ongoing research into its genetic basis and potential therapeutic targets holds promise for better future treatments.

References:
 • Recent studies on RFC1 mutations and CANVAS.
 • Clinical guidelines for the diagnosis and management of cerebellar ataxias.
 • Rehabilitation strategies for neurodegenerative disorders.

Feel free to ask any questions or request further details on specific aspects of CANVAS.

title: Congenital neuromuscular disorders and anesthetic implications
description:
1. Pre-Junctional Disorders
- Charcot-Marie-Tooth: Peripheral denervation, avoid DNMBDs, prolonged NNMBD effects
- Friedreich Ataxia: Progressive ataxia, cardiac issues, avoid DNMBDs and negative inotropes

2. Post-Junctional Disorders
Dystrophies:
- Duchenne MD: Most common childhood type, dystrophin def
  - Avoid DNMBDs and volatiles (risk of rhabdomyolysis)
  - Reduce NNMBD dose, careful with reversal
  - Monitor for blood loss and maintain volume
Myotonias:
- Myotonic Dystrophy:
  - Features: Muscle wasting + incomplete relaxation
  - Avoid triggers (hypothermia, shivering)
  - Careful with NNMBD reversal
  - Watch for cardiac conduction issues
- Myotonia Congenita:
  - Most resistant to NNMBDs
  - Chloride channel dysfunction
  - Severe contractions can't be relaxed by NNMBDs
  - Consider sodium channel blockers for contractures
Periodic Paralysis:
- Hyperkalemic: Avoid potassium-releasing drugs, DNMBDs
- Hypokalemic: Associated with MH risk, monitor K+ levels

3. Metabolic/Mitochondrial Disorders
- Monitor metabolic status
- Avoid hypothermia
- May need glucose/amino acid infusion
- Watch for cardiac conduction issues
- Careful with local anesthetics and propofol

Key Management Principles:
1. Most conditions: Avoid DNMBDs
2. Monitor respiratory function
3. Watch for cardiac complications
4. Temperature management important
5. Careful dosing and reversal of NNMBDs when needed

title: Ataxie van friedreich
Causas das Ataxias Cerebelares -  Parte 1 #verdecann #sistemaendocanabinoide #cbd
description:
* Ataxias Hereditárias
As ataxias de origem genética são geralmente progressivas e podem ser transmitidas de forma dominante ou recessiva. Algumas das mais conhecidas incluem:
1. Ataxia de Friedreich:
Doença hereditária autossômica recessiva causada por mutações no gene FXN, responsável pela produção da frataxina, uma proteína essencial para a função mitocondrial. Manifesta-se geralmente entre os 5 e 15 anos de idade, com dificuldade na marcha, perda de reflexos, escoliose e problemas cardíacos.
2. Ataxias Espinocerebelares (SCA – Spinocerebellar Ataxias): Grupo de doenças genéticas autossômicas dominantes caracterizadas por neurodegeneração progressiva do cerebelo e, em alguns casos, do tronco encefálico e medula espinhal. Os sintomas incluem marcha instável, tremores, dificuldades na fala e nos movimentos oculares.
3. Ataxia Telangiectasia: Doença genética rara, de herança autossômica recessiva, que afeta múltiplos sistemas. Caracteriza-se por ataxia progressiva na infância, telangiectasias (vasos sanguíneos dilatados visíveis na pele) e deficiência imunológica. Aumenta o risco de infecções e câncer.
4. Ataxia Episódica: Grupo de doenças genéticas raras causadas por mutações em canais iônicos, resultando em episódios temporários de descoordenação. Os ataques podem ser desencadeados por estresse, fadiga ou exercícios físicos.

title: The Outsiders: Patsy Spybey - John Pilger Documentary Interview - FULL FILM - Best Quality (1983)
description:
John Pilger Documentaries & Filmography: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLMV4WsADf_cKpptqKxqwkw1GIF9Or965w
All 9 Episodes of THE OUTSIDERS: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLMV4WsADf_cIt6APfDn3DKD8jSfgPN6Nz

1983. John Pilger interviews Patsy Spybey who sought treatment abroad when she was told there was no hope of recovery from a wasting disease. Despite criticism of her actions, she is now recovering.

Friedreich's ataxia (FRDA) is the name of the condition that Patsy Spybey suffered from, and I vaguely remember looking after some patients in a London hospital with that very debilitating condition. They suffered a lot. 

If you know how things went for Patsy, please leave a comment. It would be very interesting to find out. I hope she is doing ok. Interestingly, I have come across this news report, which, if this is the same person, suggests Spybey was still alive in 2001, but was suffering from cancer and wished to be discharged from hospital, due to multiple cancelled operations, and be allowed to 'die with dignity': https://www.thefreelibrary.com/%27LET+ME+DIE+IN+DIGNITY%27.-a077304234

RE; Video Copyright: John Pilger historically had a deal with UK television bosses, to allow his films be released into the public domain. True to his sentiment, I'm sharing this full film here, and will do so with many of his other most important films too. If you haven't watched any of his films before, they are a must watch. He is one of the - if not THE - greatest documentary filmmakers, and also journalists, of his generation!

RIP John Pilger, you are greatly missed!

title: 27INTERMIDIATE FILAMENT LAMIN CELL NUCLEUSHUTSHINSON GILFORD PROGERIA SYND HGPS  USMLE TYPE QUESTION
description:
CLUES FOR THE AMSWERS!!!!
(A) Duchenne muscular dystrophy → Dystrophin mutation, presents with proximal muscle weakness, Gower's sign, and cardiomyopathy, but no premature aging.
(C) Myotonic dystrophy → CTG repeat expansion, presents with myotonia, cataracts, and frontal balding.
(D) Xeroderma pigmentosum → Defective nucleotide excision repair, causes UV sensitivity and skin cancers, but no lamin defects.
(E) Friedreich ataxia → GAA repeat in frataxin gene, causes ataxia, cardiomyopathy, and scoliosis, but no progeria-like features.

title: Mis 3 únicos hijos tienen una enfermedad neurodegenerativa - Marian | Un Propósito #53
description:
🟡Suscríbete para no perderte ningún episodio del PODCAST

En este episodio tenemos a una persona muy especial, Marian. Una madre que tras tener a sus hijos, descubrió que todo ellos tenían una enfermedad rara, hereditaria, sin cura ni tratamiento; la ataxia de Friedreich. A partir de ahí, empezó su lucha y concienciación por la felicidad de sus hijos a través de redes (viviendo con ataxia) y muchos otros medios. En este episodio hablamos de la ataxia de Friedreich, enfermedades raras, investigación, incertidumbre, duelo por enfermedad, maternidad, inteligencia emocional, psicología, el momento presente, concienciación, empatía, educación y muchas cosas más...

title: 하버드 의대 박사가 밝히는 NMN과 인체 실험의 기대 효과  #nmn #데이비드싱클레어
description:
하버드 의대 박사가 밝히는 ‘NMN과 인체 실험의 기대 효과’

현재 NMN의 효과를 확인하기 위해 5개의 임상 시험이 진행 중입니다.
그중 하나는 **프리드리히 운동실조증(Friedreich’s Ataxia)**이라는 희귀 질환을 대상으로 하고 있으며,
가장 주목할 만한 연구는 미군의 지원을 받아 건강한 남성을 대상으로 진행되고 있습니다.

🧬 NMN은 혈류와 산소 공급을 개선할까?
쥐 실험 결과, NMN을 섭취한 쥐들은
✔️ 더 멀리, 더 오래 달릴 수 있었고
✔️ 혈류와 산소 공급이 크게 개선되었습니다.

💊 사람에게도 같은 효과가 나타날까?
현재 진행 중인 임상 시험에서는
✔️ 콜레스테롤과 혈압 감소
✔️ 체력 및 혈류 개선 등의 긍정적인 결과가 관찰되고 있습니다.
만약 쥐 실험과 같은 효과가 인간에게도 나타난다면, NMN의 가능성은 더욱 커질 것입니다.

🗣️ 여러분은 어떻게 생각하시나요? NMN, 직접 시도해볼 의향이 있나요? 👇

#NMN #노화방지 #항노화 #장수 #건강보조제 #하버드연구 #체력증가 #혈압조절

‌
اگرچه این دارو در کشورهای دیگر تأیید شده، دسترسی به آن برای بیماران ایرانی، بدلیل هزینه بالا، همچنان محدود است. ما در این پیج تلاش می‌کنیم تا با همکاری شما عزیزان، صدای بیماران را به گوش مسئولان و متخصصان برسانیم و امکان دسترسی به این درمان مهم را فراهم کنیم.‌

💊The first and only approved drug for treating Friedreich's ataxia works by reducing oxidative stress in cells, significantly slowing down the progression of the disease.

Although this drug is approved in other countries, access to it for Iranian patients remains limited due to high costs. On this page, we strive to raise awareness and, with your support, bring the voices of patients to the attention of authorities and specialists, aiming to make this vital treatment more accessible.

title: Post 47 | Windows Into The Outside World.
description:
Welcome to The Wobbles Project, a mission inspired by my journey and driven by a simple yet profound belief: that empowerment and resilience can transform lives, no matter the challenges. I’m Andrew Marshall, and I’ve lived with Friedreich’s Ataxia—a degenerative neuromuscular disorder that has profoundly shaped my life. Yet, my story is about more than this diagnosis. It’s about finding strength, joy, and purpose in sharing my experiences with others.

Through The Wobbles Project, I’m dedicated to creating a community where support, knowledge, and connection thrive. This initiative is an umbrella over various projects that all aim to make a meaningful impact for people with disabilities, beginning with accessible technology. For so many, devices like tablets open up a world of communication, learning, and independence. It’s my goal to provide this “window into the outside world” for those who might not otherwise have the chance.

The Wobbles Project encompasses my personal story, my YouTube channel, and a range of future projects—all united in the mission to empower and inspire.

Windows into the Outside World: This is my heart and the first branch to The Wobbles Project. Through this arm, I aim to provide technology to those in need, beginning with tablet donations to kids and adults with disabilities. Technology has been essential to my life, and it’s my goal to pass along the empowerment it brings.

title: Dysdiadochokinesia #medicine #medicalstudent #clinicalmedicine #Dysdiadochokinesia #neetpreparation
description:
Dysdiadochokinesia (DDK) is a motor disorder characterized by an inability to perform rapid, alternating movements. It typically indicates cerebellar dysfunction. The condition is assessed by asking a person to perform tasks like rapidly flipping their hands or alternating between pronation and supination.

Causes:
 • Cerebellar lesions: Stroke, tumors, MS, or cerebellar atrophy.
 • Toxins: Alcohol, medications, and vitamin deficiencies (e.g., B12, thiamine).
 • Genetic disorders: Spinocerebellar ataxia, Friedreich’s ataxia.
 • Trauma or infections: Head injury, encephalitis.

Diagnosis:
 • Clinical exam: Observing movement tasks like pronation-supination.
 • Imaging: MRI/CT to identify cerebellar damage.
 • Blood tests: For toxins or deficiencies.

Treatment:
 • Address underlying cause: Treat stroke, MS, or correct vitamin deficiencies.
 • Physical therapy: To improve coordination.
 • Discontinue toxins: Alcohol or drugs if involved.

title: Post 42 | Empowering Mobility: Portable Wheelchair Ramps
description:
In this video, we'll demonstrate how portable wheelchair ramps can significantly enhance the independence of individuals with mobility challenges, like Andrew who lives with Friedreich's Ataxia. We'll explore the ease and convenience of using these ramps for entering and exiting vehicles, as well as the cost-effectiveness compared to installing a permanent wheelchair lift.
Benefits of Portable Wheelchair Ramps:
• Easy to Use: Portable ramps are lightweight and fold compactly for easy storage and transportation. They can be quickly deployed and adjusted to accommodate various vehicle heights and wheelchair sizes.
• Versatility: These ramps are not limited to specific vehicles and can be used at home, work, or any location with step or height differences.
• Cost-Effective: Compared to installing a wheelchair lift, portable ramps offer a more affordable solution, making them accessible to a wider range of individuals.
• Maintains Vehicle Resale Value: Unlike permanent modifications, portable ramps can be removed without affecting the vehicle's resale value.
Demonstration:
We'll showcase the step-by-step process of using a portable wheelchair ramp to transfer Andrew and his wheelchair into a vehicle. This will include:
• Selecting the appropriate ramp size and type
• Positioning the ramp securely against the vehicle
• Safely manoeuvring the wheelchair onto the ramp
• Securing the wheelchair within the vehicle
Additional Considerations:
• Ramp length and slope are crucial for safe and comfortable transfers.
• Ramp materials should be durable and weather-resistant.
• Look for ramps with non-slip surfaces for added safety.

Portable wheelchair ramps provide a practical and affordable solution for individuals with mobility challenges, enabling them to maintain their independence and participate fully in everyday activities. By offering easy access to vehicles, these ramps empower individuals like Andrew to live more fulfilling lives.

If you or someone you know could benefit from a portable wheelchair ramp, consider exploring the various options available and discover how this simple solution can make a significant difference in their lives.

Note: Please ensure you follow all safety guidelines and instructions provided with your specific wheelchair ramp.

Advancing Rare Disease Research and Patient Advocacy | Notre Dame Stories
description:
In the United States, a disease must affect fewer than 200,000 people to be considered rare, but there are over 8,000 known rare diseases. That leaves the chances of being diagnosed with a rare disease in the U.S. at around 1 in 10, yet research and funding remain scarce. 

Rare diseases, commonly referred to as "orphan diseases," are often overlooked. As a result, effective treatments exist for less than 5% of all rare diseases, leaving millions of people without viable options.

Notre Dame is committed to understanding, treating, and advocating for those affected by rare diseases. This episode of Notre Dame Stories explores how researchers at the Boler-Parseghian Center for Rare Diseases are driving groundbreaking research to uncover new treatments and bring hope to patients and families.

Guests
  •  Barb Calhoun, Reisenauer Family Director for Patient Advocacy Education and Outreach; Director of Minor in Science and Patient Advocacy
  •  Sean Kassen, Director of the Ara Parseghian Medical Research Fund at the University of Notre Dame

-----
Video Chapters
00:00 Introduction: Fighting for those with rare diseases
04:57 Barb Calhoun shares her Notre Dame story
06:11 Barb discusses the benefits of rare disease research in a non-medical school
07:21 Barb talks about the Patient Advocacy Minor offered at Notre Dame.
09:07 Barb shares how the Patient Advocacy Program impacts students
11:57 Barb and Jenna share the inspiring story of a student with Friedreich's ataxia
16:24 What it means that Notre Dame is committed to patient advocacy
18:41 How Dean Santiago Schnell leads with compassion and serves as a role model to others
21:57 Sean Kassen shares his Notre Dame story
24:48 How the Boler-Parseghian Center for Rare Diseases came to be 
28:56 Sean shares his personal motivation for working with those with rare disease
29:54 How Notre Dame connects with families for rare disease research
33:12 Sean talks about recent and upcoming breakthroughs in rare disease research
35:04 Sean shares new Niemann-Pick Type C treatment options available
36:11 Sean tells us why rare disease research is so important to him

-----

It was created by the Office of Public Affairs and Communications and hosted by Jenna Liberto with Executive Producer Andy Fuller. It was produced by Jenna Liberto, Josh Long, and Staci Stickovich. title: صدای بیماران آتاکسی فردریش را بشنویم      Let’s hear the voices of Friedreich's ataxia patients.
description:
⭐ما هر روز با چالش‌هایی روبه‌رو می‌شویم که برای بسیاری قابل تصور نیست. در این ویدئو، بیماران آتاکسی فردریش از درد، امید و مبارزه‌شان می‌گویند—از دنیایی که در آن، راه رفتن، صحبت کردن و حتی نفس کشیدن، تبدیل به یک مبارزه روزمره می‌شود.

در کنار آن‌ها، پزشکان از تنها داروی تایید شده ی این بیماری بنام اسکایکلاریز و آینده‌ی روشن ژن‌درمانی در کشورمان صحبت می‌کنند—روزنه‌ای از امید برای درمانی که می‌تواند زندگی‌ها را تغییر دهد و نیازمند دست هایی برای حمایت است.
فیلم کامل صحبت های بیماران در قالب یک ویدئو طولانی تر طی ر‌وزهای آتی پست خواهد شد. از حمایت شما جهت دیده شدن این عزیزان متشکریم❤️🙏🏻
📢 این ویدئو فقط یک داستان نیست؛ یک فریاد است. به اشتراک بگذارید تا این صدا خاموش نماند!

Every day, we face challenges that many cannot even imagine. In this video, patients with Friedreich's ataxia speak about their pain, hope, and struggle—a world where walking, speaking, and even breathing become daily battles.  

Alongside them, doctors discuss the only approved medication for this disease, called Skyclarys, and the promising future of gene therapy in our country—a ray of hope for a treatment that can change lives and needs helping hands for support.  

The full video featuring patients' testimonies will be posted in the coming days. We sincerely appreciate your support in raising awareness for these brave individuals. ❤️🙏🏻  

📢 This video is not just a story; it’s a cry for help. Share it to keep this voice alive!

title: Gdy ciało traci zasilanie… Tajemnica Ataksji Friedreicha
description:
Komentarze pod filmem są wyłączone ze względu na ustalenia z partnerem, dzięki któremu mogliśmy zrealizować ten film. Zapraszamy do dyskusji o odcinku na naszych innych kanałach! 😊

W tym odcinku w przystępny sposób przedstawiamy, jak Ataksja Friedreicha niszczy „wewnętrzne elektrownie” organizmu, stopniowo odcinając zasilanie ciała. Dowiesz się, dlaczego mitochondria zaczynają szwankować, jak prowadzi to do problemów z mową, ruchem, sercem i nerwami oraz dlaczego choroba ta wciąż jest tak mało znana.
http://www.ataksjafriedreicha.pl/

🧬 Co to jest Ataksja Friedreicha i jak wpływa na organizm?
⚡ Dlaczego nasze komórki tracą energię i co mają z tym wspólnego mitochondria?
🚨 Jakie są pierwsze objawy i dlaczego łatwo je przeoczyć?
🩺 Jak wygląda diagnostyka i czy istnieją skuteczne metody leczenia?

Nie zapomnij zasubskrybować naszego kanału, aby nie przegapić kolejnych odcinków, w których w prosty sposób tłumaczymy trudne medyczne zagadnienia! Podziel się tym filmem, aby zwiększyć świadomość o Ataksji Friedreicha i pomóc w szerzeniu wiedzy o chorobach rzadkich!

#AtaksjaFriedreicha #Mitochondria #ChorobyRzadkie #Genetyka #Zdrowie #Nauka #Medycyna

title: Trinucleotide Repeat Disorders- Huntigtons, Fredreichs Ataxia, Fragile X syndrome Myotonic Dystrophy
La Intención de la Alegría | Jazmín Casandra Lago | TEDxYerbaBuena
description:
Jazmín tiene una enfermedad poco frecuente: Ataxia de Friedreich. Pero su enfermedad no la define, aunque ha enriquecido su vida de maneras inesperadas. Ella misma dice que uno de sus mayores logros fue aprender a pedir ayuda y aceptarla, también caer sin golpearse. Ama la vida, y considera que las emociones positivas hay que alimentarlas, como todo. Cómo se alimenta al cuerpo, hay que alimentar la mente y regar los vínculos. En pocas palabras, Jazmín se considera una militante de la alegría.
Su testimonio es inspirador y el trabajo que realiza, además de su solidaridad, compromiso y entrega, deben ser reconocidos. Jazmín Cassandra Lago, tiene 28 años. Estudia la carrera de piano en el Conservatorio de la Provincia. Es presidente de la Fundación Ataxias y otras Neurodegenerativas, y tiene una enfermedad poco frecuente, Ataxia de Friedreich. Pero su enfermedad no la define, aunque ha enriquecido su vida de maneras inesperadas. This talk was given at a TEDx event using the TED conference format but independently organized by a local community. Learn more at https://www.ted.com/tedx

title: Fisioterapia para Ataxia Cerebelar EQUILÍBRIO
description:
✅️ A ataxia cerebelar é um distúrbio neurológico caracterizado pela falta de coordenação dos movimentos devido a disfunção do cerebelo. Pode afetar a marcha, o equilíbrio, a coordenação dos membros, a fala e até mesmo os movimentos oculares.

Causas

A ataxia cerebelar pode ser causada por diversas condições, como:

Doenças genéticas (ex.: ataxias espinocerebelares, ataxia de Friedreich)

Lesões no cerebelo (ex.: AVC, traumatismo craniano)

Doenças autoimunes (ex.: esclerose múltipla)

Infecções ou intoxicações (ex.: abuso de álcool, exposição a toxinas)

Deficiências nutricionais (ex.: deficiência de vitamina B1 ou B12)


Sintomas

Dificuldade para caminhar e manter o equilíbrio

Movimentos descoordenados dos braços e pernas

Tremores durante o movimento

Dificuldade na fala (disartria)

Alterações na visão e nos reflexosConvivendo com Ataxia e Músicas  que preenchem a Alma.

title: Utrata koordynacji, osłabienie mięśni i zmęczenie. To może być Ataksja Friedriecha
description:
To uwarunkowana genetycznie, bardzo rzadka, wyniszczająca organizm choroba neurodegeneracyjna. Prowadzi m.in. do stopniowej utraty zdolności poruszania się i mówienia. Objawy rozwijają się zwykle powoli, ale nieuchronnie. Średnia długość życia chorych wynosi tylko 37 lat. 

Diagnozę stawia się na podstawie objawów klinicznych, jednak od ich wystąpienia do postawienia prawidłowej diagnozy może minąć wiele lat. Wynika to m.in. z niespecyficznych objawów w przebiegu choroby i pojawienia się czasem jako pierwszych symptomów nieneurologicznych, np. skoliozy czy kardiomiopatii. Takie przejawy Ataksji Friedriecha, jak postępująca utrata koordynacji, osłabienie mięśni i zmęczenie, mogą początkowo sugerować występowanie innych schorzeń. O tej ultrarzadkiej chorobie w rozmowie z prof. Katarzyną Kotulska-Jóźwiak kierującą Kliniką Neurologii i Epileptologii w Instytucie ’Pomnik – Centrum Zdrowia Dziecka’ w Warszawie.

title: Post 49 | Chats with Gerda Brown from the Muscular Dystrophy Foundation of South Africa.
description:
Gerda Brown the director of operations at the Muscular Dystrophy Foundation South Africa and Andrew Marshall founder of The Wobbles Project are having a chat about the foundation and how they know each other as well as the projects they have collaborated on in the past. Andrew is also sharing some insights about The Wobbles Project and how he was inspired to begin with a brand-new leg of the project called Windows Into The Outside World.
Windows Into The Outside World was originally inspired by a colleague of Andrew's mom. They gave Andrew a computer which functioned as a window into the outside world for him. The computer became his lifeline when he needed to communicate with the outside world due to his Friedreich’s Ataxia. Through this leg of the project, we hope we can empower people with technology.

title: What disabilities qualify for a service dog (under the ada)?
description:
Are you wondering what disabilities qualify for a service dog under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)? In this video, we’ll break down exactly what the ADA says about service dog eligibility, including real-life examples of who would and wouldn’t qualify.

📌 Topics Covered in This Video:
✅ What the ADA defines as a disability for service dog qualification
✅ Examples of individuals who would qualify for a service dog
✅ Examples of individuals who wouldn’t qualify
✅ Why having both training records & medical documentation is important
✅ The legal misconception about doctors’ notes & public access
✅ The difference between service dogs, emotional support animals (ESAs), and therapy dogs

Reminders:
- A doctor’s note is NOT required for public access, but having one before any legal issues arise can protect you.
- Service dogs MUST be task-trained to assist with a disability that significantly limits major life activities.
- Emotional support animals (ESAs) are NOT service dogs under federal law.
- Misusing service dog terms (ESA vs. therapy dog vs. service dog) can cause legal confusion, as well as general confusion for the public. 

*Chapters*
0:00 Introduction
1:28 What the ADA website says 
3:10 Anxiety Disorders
4:33 Mobility Disabilities

title: Ambulatory Facial Monitoring for Health with Dr Charles Nduka of Emteq Labs at the Buck Institute
description:
Dr Charles Nduka, surgeon and founder of Emteq Labs, introduces the concept of joyspan- the next metric beyond healthspan. Whereas lifespan measures the duration of life, and healthspan measures the duration of healthy years, joyspan measures the quantity of positive years. The rationale is that there is little point optimising healthspan if it leads to a worse quality of life.
In research, the quality of experiences is measured by assessing emotional valence. The most sensitive way to do this is via facial muscle activity, typically with facial electromyography. Charles Nduka invented facial optomyography as a non-contact alternative to allow passive, real-world monitoring of health, mood, dietary behaviours and neurological diseases.

By partnering with leading researchers, and health partners, Emteq Labs aims to make healthcare precise, predictive, proactive, participatory.
This talk was given at the Longevity Summit on 3rd December 2024 at the Buck Institute in California.

https://www.emteqlabs.com/
https://longevitygl.org/longevity-summit/

title: Deficiencia de aconitasa mitocondrial (mutaciones en ACO2)
description:
Deficiencia de Aconitasa Mitocondrial 

Epidemiología

La deficiencia de aconitasa mitocondrial (ACO2) es un trastorno metabólico extremadamente raro, con solo unos pocos casos reportados en la literatura médica. Se ha identificado en diversas poblaciones sin una distribución geográfica o étnica clara.

Descripción clínica

La enfermedad se manifiesta principalmente con afectación neurológica progresiva, incluyendo:
 • Retraso en el desarrollo psicomotor, con pérdida de habilidades adquiridas.
 • Ataxia cerebelosa, con dificultades en la coordinación y el equilibrio.
 • Hipotonía y espasticidad, dependiendo de la progresión de la enfermedad.
 • Discapacidad intelectual, de leve a severa.
 • Degeneración óptica y pérdida de la visión en algunos casos.
 • En casos graves, se ha reportado neurodegeneración progresiva con hipoplasia cerebelosa.

Etiología y genética

La enfermedad es causada por mutaciones en el gen ACO2, ubicado en el cromosoma 22q13.2, que codifica la enzima aconitasa mitocondrial. Esta enzima es fundamental en el ciclo de Krebs, catalizando la conversión del citrato en isocitrato. Su deficiencia provoca disfunción mitocondrial, acumulación de citrato y alteraciones en el metabolismo energético.

El patrón de herencia es autosómico recesivo, por lo que ambos padres deben ser portadores de una mutación para que su hijo herede la enfermedad.

Métodos de diagnóstico
 • Pruebas bioquímicas:
 • Disminución de la actividad de aconitasa mitocondrial en fibroblastos o tejidos afectados.
 • Acumulación de citrato en plasma y orina.
 • Estudios genéticos:
 • Identificación de mutaciones en el gen ACO2 mediante secuenciación molecular.
 • Neuroimagen (IRM cerebral):
 • Puede mostrar atrofia cerebelosa y signos de neurodegeneración progresiva.

Diagnóstico diferencial

Debe diferenciarse de otros trastornos neurometabólicos con afectación cerebelosa, tales como:
 • Enfermedades mitocondriales (mutaciones en genes como POLG o SURF1).
 • Ataxias hereditarias, incluyendo ataxia de Friedreich.
 • Síndromes neurodegenerativos con hipoplasia cerebelosa, como el síndrome de Joubert.

Asesoramiento genético

Dado que se hereda de manera autosómica recesiva, los padres de un niño afectado son portadores asintomáticos. Se recomienda pruebas genéticas para familiares y diagnóstico prenatal en embarazos con riesgo conocido.

Manejo y tratamiento

Actualmente, no existe un tratamiento curativo para la deficiencia de aconitasa mitocondrial. El manejo es sintomático y de soporte:
 • Fisioterapia y terapia ocupacional para mejorar la movilidad y el control motor.
 • Soporte nutricional, incluyendo dietas adaptadas a las necesidades metabólicas del paciente.
 • Tratamiento sintomático para la espasticidad y la ataxia.
 • Monitoreo oftalmológico y neurológico regular.

Pronóstico

El pronóstico varía según la gravedad de la enfermedad. En los casos más severos, la neurodegeneración progresiva puede llevar a una discapacidad grave y reducción en la expectativa de vida. Sin embargo, en formas más leves, los pacientes pueden presentar una progresión más lenta con manejo sintomático adecuado.

OMIM: 100850

Referencias bibliográficas
 1. Saudubray, J. M., van den Berghe, G., & Walter, J. H. (2016). Inborn Metabolic Diseases: Diagnosis and Treatment. Springer.
 2. Blau, N., Duran, M., Gibson, K. M., & Dionisi-Vici, C. (2014). Physician’s Guide to the Diagnosis, Treatment, and Follow-Up of Inherited Metabolic Diseases. Springer.
 3. Nyhan, W. L., Barshop, B. A., & Ozand, P. T. (2011). Atlas of Metabolic Diseases. Oxford University Press.
 4. Scriver, C. R., Beaudet, A. L., Sly, W. S., & Valle, D. (2001). The Metabolic and Molecular Bases of Inherited Disease. McGraw-Hill.
 5. Spiegel, R., Shaag, A., Edvardson, S., Mandel, H., & Saada, A. (2012). Deficiency of mitochondrial aconitase (ACO2) causes severe infantile cerebellar-retinal degeneration. Molecular Genetics and Metabolism, 107(1-2), 59-63.

title: Venha conhecer a Exposição: Expressões de Afeto - Mário Nelson, no Museu Inimá de Paula
description:
O Governo de Minas Gerais e Museu Inimá de Paula apresenta a exposição “Expressões de Afeto” de Mário Nelson Nepomuceno Bracarense em cartaz do dia 22 de Novembro de 2024 a 23 de Fevereiro de 2025.

Mário Nelson Nepomuceno Bracarense nasceu em Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais no ano de 1991. Teve uma infância amorosa e normal, mas no início da adolescência apresentou alguns problemas de coordenação motora. Aos 20 anos, já diagnosticado com Ataxia de Friedreich, doença degenerativa que compromete a coordenação motora e força muscular, começou a se locomover por cadeiras de rodas. Esse momento de mudança contribuiu para que Mário explorasse a escultura em argila, dando forma a cabeças e rostos que, de maneira visceral, refletem suas próprias vivências e emoções. Através da imperfeição e da intensidade das expressões faciais, o artista construiu uma conexão emocional com seu público, criando um elo entre sua presença física, gestos e materialidade.

A mostra “Expressões de Afeto” é uma homenagem à mãe do artista, Sílvia Barral, que convida o espectador a mergulhar pelo universo expressivo de Nelson. As 35 esculturas apresentadas são um retrato do afeto humano, capaz de transmitir uma vasta gama de sentimentos – da dor à felicidade, da angústia à serenidade. A produção de Mário Nelson nos leva a um diálogo profundo sobre o poder transformador da arte. Suas obras não apenas capturam o instante da expressão, mas também a narrativa da vida do próprio artista, em sua superação.

Museu Inimá de Paula - Rua da Bahia, 1.201, Centro, Belo Horizonte - MG, 30160-011

title: Treating Neuropathy With Laser Therapy
description:
Neuropathy can affect motor, sensory or autonomic nerve fibres separately or combined resulting in different symptoms. The onset of neuropathy can be acute or chronic and can affect all ages, however, some people are at greater risk with certain age-related diseases.  Among people older than 45 years, the prevalence of neuropathy is between 5-7%. Laser Therapy (photobiomodulation therapy or PBMT) when applied with optimal wavelengths, dosage and accurate location can accelerate nerve healing, increase circulation that supplies nerves, decrease pain and inflammation that may be associatyed with different types of neuropathies. J

oin BIOFLEX’s Medical Director, Dr. David Kunashko for an in-depth review of the mechanisms of how PBMT can help neuropathies including peer reviewed research, optimal parameters, treatment plans and approaches using BIOFLEX professional Laser Therapy devices.

title: Anemia asociada a enfermedades crónicas, sideroblásticas y diseritropoyéticas  l Hematología
description:
📢 Bienvenidos a esta Clase Magistral sobre Anemias Complejas, donde abordaremos tres tipos de anemias con mecanismos fisiopatológicos distintos pero clínicamente relevantes en la práctica médica: Anemia asociada a enfermedades crónicas, anemias sideroblásticas y diseritropoyéticas congénitas.

🔎 ¿Qué aprenderás en esta sesión?

✅ Anemia Asociada a Enfermedades Crónicas (AEC): 🏥

Fisiopatología: Alteraciones en la eritropoyesis mediadas por inflamación crónica 🔄
Causas: Enfermedades inflamatorias, infecciones crónicas, neoplasias y enfermedad renal crónica
Diagnóstico: Ferritina normal/alta, disminución del hierro sérico y TIBC, VCM normal/bajo
Tratamiento: Manejo de la enfermedad subyacente, eritropoyetina en casos seleccionados
✅ Anemias Sideroblásticas: 🔬

Fisiopatología: Alteración en la utilización del hierro para la síntesis de hemoglobina, acumulación en mitocondrias
Clasificación:
Congénitas: Mutaciones en genes relacionados con el metabolismo del hierro
Adquiridas: Asociadas a fármacos, alcoholismo, síndromes mielodisplásicos
Diagnóstico: Frotis sanguíneo con sideroblastos en anillo, niveles elevados de ferritina
Tratamiento: Vitamina B6 en casos hereditarios, quelantes de hierro si hay sobrecarga
✅ Anemias Diseritropoyéticas Congénitas (ADC): 🧬

Grupo de trastornos raros con eritropoyesis inefectiva y dismorfismo eritroide
Subtipos:
Tipo I: Eritroblastos multinucleados, anomalías óseas
Tipo II (HEMPAS): Hemólisis compensada, prueba de Ham positiva
Tipo III: Eritroblastos gigantes multinucleados
Diagnóstico: Biopsia de médula ósea, análisis genético, pruebas de hemólisis
Tratamiento: Transfusiones, hierro quelante, trasplante de médula ósea en casos graves
📚 Clase dirigida a médicos generales, hematólogos, internistas, residentes y profesionales de la salud interesados en anemias complejas y su manejo.

🛑 No te pierdas esta sesión magistral con información basada en evidencia científica actualizada.

🔔 ¡Suscríbete y activa las notificaciones!
✍️ Déjanos tus preguntas en los comentarios y comparte este contenido con colegas.

title: DGN 2024 Key note by Aldo Faisal "Pilotstudien mit digitalen Trackern, KI & Big data" (in German)
KIZIM - QUERIDA FILHA - NOVELA TURCA CONFIRA O ANTES E DEPOIS DOS ATORES
description:
Öykü, uma menina de 8 anos extremamente inteligente e sensível, é abandonada pela tia, que não pode mais cuidar dela. A menina então encontra seu pai biológico, Demir, um homem despreocupado e imaturo que não sabia da existência da filha. Demir é um vigarista que vive de pequenos golpes e está longe de ser um pai exemplar.

Inicialmente, Demir não quer assumir a responsabilidade de cuidar de Öykü. No entanto, a situação muda quando ele é obrigado pelo tribunal a assumir a guarda da filha para evitar a prisão. Enquanto tenta aprender a ser pai, ele descobre que Öykü sofre de uma rara doença genética chamada Ataxia de Friedreich, que afeta sua coordenação motora e pode ser degenerativa.

A série explora a transformação de Demir, que gradualmente abandona sua vida de crimes para ser um pai melhor, e o vínculo especial que se forma entre ele e Öykü. Outros personagens importantes entram na história, como Candan, uma veterinária gentil que acaba se envolvendo emocionalmente com Demir e se torna uma figura materna para Öykü.

Kızım é conhecida por sua narrativa tocante, momentos de emoção genuína e por abordar temas familiares e humanos de forma sensível.

description:
Domingo 23 de Febrero a las 4:30 AM se largó la 4ta edición de la Isquitipe Trail, 42 K, que finalmente se extendieron a poco más de 45 K

Desde el inicio el calor y la humedad se hicieron sentir al igual que el terreno técnico que nos acompañó a lo largo de todo el recorrido.

Muy buena señalización de carrera, la verdad que para destacar. 

Si bien no fue mi caso hubo una altísima tasa de abandonos debido a la altas temperaturas y las exigencias del terreno

Como siempre, la llegada dedicando una palabras a esta lucha que vengo llevando desde hace unos años hablando de  Ataxia de Friedreich.

Agradezco a todos los que hacen posible esto

Nos vemos en la próxima aventura.

description:

Explicaremos que es una mutación, los tipos de mutaciones y algunos tipos de enfermedades asociadas a las mismas.
